Pumpkin Pie.description: Preheat oven to 425°F. Whisk together sugar, salt, and spices in a small bowl. Beat eggs in a large bowl. Stir in pumpkin and sugar-spice mixture. Gradually stir in evaporated milk.
Bake for 15 minutes. Reduce temperature to 350°F; bake for 40 to 50 minutes or until knife inserted near center comes out clean. Cool on wire rack for 2 hours. Serve immediately or refrigerate.

Lobster Bisque.description: In a large pot, melt 1 tablespoon butter over medium heat. Add lobster shells and cook, stirring occasionally, until shells are bright red, about 5 minutes.
Add onion, carrot, and celery and cook, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are soft, about 5 minutes.
Add tomato paste and cook, stirring occasionally, until paste is brick red, about 2 minutes.
Add brandy and cook, stirring occasionally, until alcohol has cooked off, about 2 minutes.
Add stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until flavors have melded, about 30 minutes.
Strain stock through a fine-mesh sieve into a clean pot, pressing on solids to extract as much liquid as possible; discard solids.
In a large pot, melt remaining 2 tablespoons butter over medium heat. Add flour and cook, stirring occasionally, until mixture is pale golden, about 5 minutes.
Slowly whisk in strained stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until thickened, about 10 minutes.
Add cream and simmer until soup is thickened and flavors have melded, about 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.
